text: Pereia () was a town of Phthiotis in ancient Thessaly. In 302 BCE, Cassander planned to transfer to town's population to Phthiotic Thebes but this was prevented by Demetrius Poliorcetes. Its site is located at the modern Petroto (formerly Tsatma). ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Thessaly Category:Former populated places in Greece Category:Achaea Phthiotis
